question: Jeremiah is riding in a car that is traveling 60 miles per hour. At this rate, how many minutes will it take him to travel 20 miles?
answer: Distance equals rate times time, so the trip will take $$\frac{20\text{ mi.}}{60\text{ mph}}=\frac{1}{3}\text{ hours}.$$  One-third of an hour is $\boxed{20}$ minutes.
agents_response:
To find the time it will take Jeremiah to travel 20 miles at 60 miles per hour, we can use the formula: 

time = distance / speed 

Plugging in the values, we get: 
time = 20 miles / 60 miles per hour 

Simplifying, we get: 
time = 1/3 hour 

Converting hours to minutes (since there are 60 minutes in an hour): 
time = 1/3 hour * 60 minutes per hour = 20 minutes 

Therefore, it will take Jeremiah \boxed{20} minutes to travel 20 miles at 60 miles per hour.
